docs.snippet: LEAD: Sixty hours after being overthrown and arrested, Paraguay's former dictator, Gen. Alfredo Stroessner, was today flown out of the airport here that still carries his name and sent into exile in neighboring Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Sixty hours after being overthrown and arrested, Paraguay's former dictator, Gen. Alfredo Stroessner, was today flown out of the airport here that still carries his name and sent into exile in neighboring Brazil.

headline.main: Stroessner Flies Into Brazil Exile; Election Is Promised in 3 Months

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: WILL a Western Europe without internal trade barriers mean a more open market for the United States and other countries? Or will this Europe, to be created by the end of 1992, become ''Fortress Europe'': an inward-looking bloc that will...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WILL a Western Europe without internal trade barriers mean a more open market for the United States and other countries? Or will this Europe, to be created by the end of 1992, become ''Fortress Europe'': an inward-looking bloc that will accelerate a global trend toward regional trading blocs?

docs.snippet: LEAD: The world trade body GATT deliberated today on how to cut or freeze farm subsidies, a main cause of trade friction between the United States and Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The world trade body GATT deliberated today on how to cut or freeze farm subsidies, a main cause of trade friction between the United States and Europe.

docs.snippet: LEAD: A trade compromise being negotiated here this weekend is expected to call for the United States to ship some beef certified as hormone-free to the European Community and for the Atlantic partners to submit their dispute over the use of hormones...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A trade compromise being negotiated here this weekend is expected to call for the United States to ship some beef certified as hormone-free to the European Community and for the Atlantic partners to submit their dispute over the use of hormones to a panel of experts, American and European officials said.

headline.main: Beef Compromise Seen In U.S.-Europe Dispute

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States and the European Community have begun a new effort to resolve differences over long-term agricultural policy changes that caused a breakdown in talks on global trade liberalization two months ago in Montreal.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States and the European Community have begun a new effort to resolve differences over long-term agricultural policy changes that caused a breakdown in talks on global trade liberalization two months ago in Montreal.

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade decided today to set up a dispute panel to hear a complaint by Brazil against punitive tariffs imposed by the United States against it last fall.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The authorities charged at least 33 people and a corporation today with laundering more than $500 million in Colombian cocaine profits through jewelry merchants in New York, Los Angeles, Texas and Florida.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The authorities charged at least 33 people and a corporation today with laundering more than $500 million in Colombian cocaine profits through jewelry merchants in New York, Los Angeles, Texas and Florida.

docs.snippet: LEAD: As the full implications of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's death sentence on the British author Salman Rushdie sink in, his friends here are saying that whatever happens to him in the future, he will never be able to go back to the highly active...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As the full implications of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's death sentence on the British author Salman Rushdie sink in, his friends here are saying that whatever happens to him in the future, he will never be able to go back to the highly active and visible life he was leading until last week.

headline.main: His Life Transformed, Rushdie Is 'Bearing Up'

byline.original: By CRAIG R. WHITNEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The European Community said today that the United States' latest move to increase subsidies for farm exports suggested that Washington was not committed to serious reforms.
